“The thing about them is they’re made to look like prisons.”

“Max,” said Sally, still raising her hand. “Have you ever even been to prison?” 

“Well, no, but—”

“Then how do you know?”

"Well, my—”

Max was too embarrassed to finish the sentence, and Mr. P sensed it. 

“Sally, please let’s save questions until after the presentation.”

Sally sort of rolled her eyes to the side, shrank in her seat and crossed her arms in defiance, but, of course, continued to listen.
